info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 10:25PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Callahan, northwestern Brown and northeastern Coleman Counties through 1115 PM CST... At 1025 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Coleman, or 9 miles southeast of Oplin, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cross Plains and Us-283 Near The Coleman-Callahan County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for west central Texas.
